item.title: Don't Rebuild Your Docker Image Locally
item.description: A few weeks ago, I came across this article titled “You Don’t Need to Rebuild Your Development Docker Image on Every Code Change.” As I use Docker for most of my projects, this piqued my interest. The gist of it is, you can mount your local development directory to a Docker image instead of copying your source code to the image and building it. While you wouldn’t want to do this for anything other than local development, it does help drastically with making changes and seeing them reflect as quickly as possible.
